title: British social media start-up Howdoo is a hit for pop star singer Sinitta
text:
Star draw: Singer Sinitta is backing the ambitious social media start-up Howdoo

A British social media start-up backed by pop star Sinitta plans a launch early next year to take on some of the world's biggest technology giants.

Howdoo, which also boasts support from IBM and Hewlett Packard, will position itself as an alternative to Facebook, YouTube, Instagram and others.

Founder David Brierley said he is aiming at millennials and those slightly younger – Generation Z.

'We are laser-focused on millennials and Gen Z users who at the moment hop between SnapChat, TikTok and Twitch,' he explained. 'They're not really on Facebook and they think Instagram is a bit boring.'

The platform will allow videos and streaming content from users.

Talks have been held with corporate publishers which could potentially position Howdoo as an alternative to global streaming services. It will be compatible with Apple, Android and Huawei phones.

The site is being tested with 6,000 users and is aiming to counter issues which have left users, advertisers and content providers feeling 'exploited'.

'We believe we can become profitable without exploiting those three constituent parts,' added Brierley. 'Users can come on for free and choose whether to share their digital footprint with advertisers.

'We don't try to steal the content from the content creators and the advertisers know the users they get access to have opted in for marketing.'
